description: Retrieves all of the fields and values of a single log event.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: Retrieving log records can help identify details about cloud accounts in use, such as who accessed certain services and when.
Logs may contain information about processes running in the cloud environment, which can help in identifying active processes and their behavior.
Log records can reveal information about system owners or users who are interacting with the cloud environment, such as user activity logs and access patterns.

Log records can show instances where default accounts are being used, which could be a security risk if not properly managed. Logs can reveal the use of local accounts within the cloud environment, which can then be assessed for potential security risks.

incidents.description: Compromised Cloud Compute Credentials: Case Studies From the Wild

securityImplications: Attackers might use GetLogRecord to precisely extract information from CloudWatch logs, potentially exposing sensitive data or insights into AWS operational activities.
